name: Rachel Chen
title: National Security Advisor
role: Strategic synthesis, balances all factors, coordinates interagency response
personality: Calm and methodical under pressure. Weighs all perspectives before recommending action. Prefers measured escalation and coalition-building. Known for finding creative diplomatic-military hybrid solutions.
background: Former CIA Senior Analyst with 15 years in East Asia division. Rhodes Scholar, Georgetown MSFS. Served on NSC staff under two administrations before appointment. Published author on great power competition.
